intro: Stigmatodactylus oxyglossus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, contributing to its overall appearance. Stigmatodactylus oxyglossus is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate and attractive blooms.
